catalog_info.title: Nonfiction Video Projects
catalog_info.notes: In exceptional cases, a student will be permitted to take the course without having filmed over the summer, but the student must have a specific proposal for a documentary that can be both shot and edited during the term. An interview with the instructor is required for admission. FIRST MEETING NOTE: Wednesday, Sept. 2 from 1pm-2pm in Sever B10.    Interested students must attend first meeting of class during shopping week to speak with teaching staff about course enrollment procedure.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: At least one VES course in live-action film or video.
catalog_info.description: Working from a proposal approved in advance by the instructor, each student plans, shoots, and edits a documentary video of his or her design. Shooting should take place over the summer and editing during the fall term. Readings and screenings augment individual work.
